content.description: Climbs the clean northwest face of the northern and larger boulder past three bolts via good edges. Short but demanding.
A traversing face climb located immediately left of "Left Double Feature Crack".  Follow flakes and edges up and right past three bolts to a reachy crux move gaining the upper bit of LDFC.
content.location: This route traverses the bolted face left of "Left Double Feature Crack" and joins that route for the final 10'.  Walk-off down the slabby east side of the boulder.

content.description: This little route is really fun but way too short.  Remember to place pro, as you can really haul, so you don't deck because there are a couple of moves here.  Miracle Mile Boulders are west from the Zsa Zsa Gabor Memorial Boulder; go down the gully and up toward a "pass" on the ridge.  In the book in may be 200 yds. as the crow flies.  Hiking I would say it is more like 500 yards.  As soon as you crest the ridge the Miracle Mile Boulders are about another 100 yards west on the same level.  If you stay just left of a small shelf/cliff formation of dark red rock at the crest of the ridge you'll walk right into the boulders.
content.protection: Medium nuts; cams.  I used a #10 BD hex for a bomber piece at the belay.

content.description: Climb the left of the two cracks on the smaller boulder. This is a flake/crack with some fun climbing that unfortunately is over all too quickly. Worth checking out if in the area as an alternative to all the face climbing around.
